text: hi I'm Jason a channel account manager
on the AWS marketplace team in this
presentation you'll be provided with an
overview of the AWS marketplace channel
programs and the opportunities those
programs present for consulting partners
like you whether you're a system
integrator a value-added reseller a
managed solution provider born in the
cloud or any other type of partner these
programs are designed to help you help
your customers take advantage of the
benefits that are available to them when
they procure and deploy software from
AWS marketplace before we dive into the
channel program details let's review
what AWS marketplace is by starting with
the definition AWS marketplace is a
curated digital software catalog that
makes it easy to find test buy and
deploy software and services that your
customers need to build products and run
their business in short it's an app
store that sells third-party commercial
software solutions that are easily
procured and deployed into your
customers AWS environment AWS
marketplace started seven years ago and
there has been a lot of growth since
those first days today there are over
1,400 sellers or independent software
vendors listing over 4,200 software
products on marketplace beyond the
numbers what this means is the most
popular software products from the most
popular sellers are available today AWS
marketplace makes it very easy to deploy
software on demand with just a click you
or your customer can deploy software
into your customers AWS environment you
can procure brand new software or you
can leverage existing on-prem licenses
via BYO l or bring your own license
another advantage of procuring software
from AWS marketplace is that purchases
are consolidated on your AWS account
invoice this could be your AWS master
account or your customers account and
I'll go into more details on accounts a
little later in this presentation
AWS marketplace is available worldwide
and deployed in all eighteen regions and
in regards to the last two numbers
170,000 active customers purchasing
products that are driving 550 million
ec2 hours every single
month just about two years ago those
numbers were about a third of that so
this speaks to the growth of AWS
marketplace and how cloud market places
in general are transforming software
procurement with the world of software
procurement changing how do you as a
consulting partner take advantage of
this growth with AWS marketplace
there are proved two programs available
to help you the channel incentive
program or chip for short enables
consulting partners like you to earn 10%
credit reselling software from
participating sellers on AWS marketplace
the second program private offers
enables you to negotiate private pricing
and custom terms directly with sellers
and purchase on AWS marketplace now
let's break down each of these two
programs first the channel incentive
program or chip chip enables consulting
partners like you to earn that 10%
credit just by reselling software from
participating sellers on AWS marketplace
the program is available to consulting
partners that are also AWS solution
providers you must be part of the AWS
solution provider program to participate
in the chip program additionally to
qualify for the 10% software products
purchased from AWS marketplace must be
from a participating seller that is also
in the chip program the software may be
purchased via your AWS master account or
the customer can purchase via their
linked account which is an account
that's linked to your master account and
again I'll go into more detail on
accounts a little later in the
presentation ultimately you will receive
an AWS credit memo that you can apply to
your master account so let's walk
through this at a high level on the left
side of the slide you an AWS consulting
partner who is also an AW a solution
provider will purchase software on AWS
marketplace using your master account or
your customer will purchase via their
linked account next the software that
you purchased is deployed into your
customers linked account following that
usage for that software is totaled
monthly and AWS will invoice the account
for the purchase software finally once
AWS receives payment we will pay the
seller and also invoice the seller for
10% of the transaction value
once we receive payment from the seller
you can apply a credit memo to your
master account okay so what do you need
to do to get started to participate in
the chip program step one as mentioned
you need to be or become an AWS solution
provider if you are not an AWS solution
provider already the website you see
listed there is where you can learn more
and at the end of this presentation
you'll be provided with more information
and where you'll be able to access this
link and others moving on to step two
you need to sign the AWS marketplace
challenge Center program addendum this
is required if you want to participate
in this specific program and if you are
already part of the AWS solution
provider program you will have already
signed this addendum finally you need to
resell software products listed on AWS
marketplace from participating sellers
so earlier I mentioned the marketplace
catalog currently has over 4,200
products from 1,400 sellers a subset of
those products are available through the
chip program and these are the current
sellers participating in chip this is
current as of July 2018 and growing you
can access the most current list via the
link noted on the bottom of the slide
and again at the end of this video
presentation you'll be provided with
information on how to learn more
including how to obtain this deck with
clickable links to better understand
these channel programs it's helpful to
visualize how AWS accounts work and
specifically the relationship between
master accounts and linked accounts to
help illustrate this let's walk through
a scenario where the consulting partner
in the chip program is purchasing on
behalf of their customer using their
master account in this scenario you as
the consulting partner can procure
software via your master account and
deploy that software to your customers
linked account and again remember if
you're participating in chip this means
you're also an AWS solution provider
once you procure from AWS marketplace
you deploy into linked accounts which
are which are your customers account
here you see one linked account to your
master account the linked account
represents your customer but you can
have multiple linked accounts
representing each of your customers as
you now see here now that you have a
high level and
of AWS account types let's walk through
a chip program scenario where you are
procuring software on behalf of your
customer first you purchase or subscribe
to a software product on behalf of your
customer from AWS marketplace using your
master account next the software is
deployed to the appropriate AWS linked
account ie your customers account AWS
tracks usage and will invoice you the
consulting partner monthly in this
scenario you purchased the software on
behalf of your customer so then you will
invoice your customer the customer pays
you the consulting partner and then you
pay AWS AWS will pay the seller and we
will also invoice the seller for 10
percent of the value of the billed
purchase when AWS receives payment from
the seller we will issue an AWS credit
memo that you can apply to your master
account so let's break this down with
some easy numbers if the monthly bill
was a hundred bucks
eventually you as the consulting partner
would receive $10 or 10% applied as a
credit memo to your master account now
we'll review the private offers program
which enables you the consulting partner
to negotiate private pricing and custom
terms with AWS marketplace sellers this
means you can negotiate a price that is
different from the list price on AWS
marketplace and this means you have the
ability to negotiate a discount from the
seller and can resell the product to
your end customer with markup for your
value-added services once negotiated you
and the seller are required to submit a
one-page transaction request form or
what we often refer to as the trf2 AWS
marketplace the TRF includes details on
the private offer terms including the
product being sold the agreed-upon price
the AWS account number purchasing the
software and other relevant information
this information allows us to create a
unique URL that reflects the terms of
the private offer you and the seller
have negotiated and agreed upon once the
private offer URL is created and
available you can subscribe via your AWS
master account and deploy this into your
customers linked account alternatively
your customer can deploy the private
offer directly into an unlinked account
in both scenarios the customer does not
see the private pricing you and the
seller have negotiated and agreed upon
any consulting partner can participate
in the private offer program there is no
requirement to be an AWS solution
provider and you do not have to link
your customers account to your AWS
account so let's walk through a high
level flow Illustrated on the left side
of the screen you as the consulting
partner and the seller your ISP partner
agree to pricing and terms once we at
AWS marketplace have the details of the
private offer via a completed TRF form
we will create a private offer a unique
URL that can be used for purchasing and
deploying the software whether you
deploy into your customers linked
account or the customer subscribes
directly via and unlinked account AWS
will invoice the consulting partner
based on private pricing and Terms
outlined in the TRF you own the
responsibility for invoicing your
customer and paying the AWS invoice
retaining any markup that you have
charged the customer once we receive
payment we will then disburse funds to
the seller whose software was procured
and deployed from AWS marketplace there
are two common scenarios for private
offers when a consulting partner is
involved one is a consulting partner as
the buyer and one is the consulting
partner in a more traditional reseller
scenario this slide walks through a flow
of a consulting partner as a buyer to
start the consulting partner and seller
negotiate private pricing and custom
terms complete and signed the TRF and
submit to AWS marketplace AWS
marketplace will then create a unique
URL for the private offer next the
consulting partner subscribes to the
private offer via the AWS master account
using that limited visibility URL AWS
marketplace invoices the consulting
partner based on the terms agreed to in
the TRF the consulting partner then
deploys the software into their
customers linked AWS account next the
consulting partner invoices their
customer the price invoiced is
negotiated by the consulting partner and
their customer but typically this is the
price that you have negotiated with the
seller plus markup for value-added
services and your margin
the customer will then pay you the
consulting partners invoice and the
consulting partner will pay AWS
marketplace again retaining the mark-up
charged to the customer of any an AWS
marketplace will pay the seller so now
let's take a look at another common
scenario which is when the consulting
partner is transacting in a traditional
resale mode just like the previous
scenario the consulting partner and the
seller negotiate private pricing and
custom terms complete and signed the TRF
and submit to AWS marketplace we will
then go ahead and create a unique URL
for the private offer next your end
customer then subscribes to the private
offer using their AWS account remember
the price you negotiated with the seller
is not visible to the customer the
software is deployed into the customers
account and then AWS marketplace
invoices the consulting partner based on
the terms agreed to on the TRF next you
the consulting partner will invoice your
customer the price invoice reflects
whatever was negotiated between you and
the customer but again this is typically
the price that you negotiated with the
seller plus markup for value-added
services or margin the customer pays the
consulting partners invoice and the
consulting partner ultimately pays us
AWS marketplace again retaining the
markup charge to the customer of any AWS
marketplace will then pay the seller so
let's review both channel programs the
channel incentive program or chip and
the private offers program the chip
program is a resell only program
consulting partners must be an AWS
solution provider which means you are
authorized to resell AWS services
private offers are a little bit
different consulting partners can be a
reseller or a refer we didn't cover the
reefer scenario in this presentation but
in short this means that the customer
buys directly from the seller and you
are paid a referral incentive from the
seller in both scenarios there is no
requirement to be an AWS solution
provider with chimp the incentive is 10%
of the value of the transaction it's
paid to you in the form of a credit memo
that you can apply to your master
account for private offers the incentive
is negotiable it depends on what you've
negotiated with the seller ie
the discount you've received from there
this price and ultimately how much you
then charge your customer including
markup for margin the payer is
ultimately your customer in the resale
scenario we reviewed you invoice the
customer the customer pays you and you
will pay AWS retaining your markup if
any in the referral scenario the pair is
the seller and payment depends on the
referral incentive you negotiated and
agreed to with the seller deal
registration is not required for chip if
you are participating in chip and you
are reselling any product listed on AWS
marketplace from a chip participating
seller AWS monitors those transactions
and provides monthly reporting to you to
obtain your chip credits for private
offers deal registration is required
in the form of a TR F that transaction
request form which includes information
specific to that opportunity to learn
more contact the AWS marketplace channel
account management team at the email
alias you see on the screen there this
alias is actively monitored by everyone
on the team and we'd be happy to provide
you with more information on the
programs reviewed in this presentation
send you a copy of this slide deck with
clickable links sign you up to receive
our monthly newsletter and answer any
other questions that you may have this
concludes our brief overview of the AWS
marketplace channel programs thank you
